intro: Dendrolobium rostratum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf burr legume, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its woody, shrub-like growth habit and produces distinctive burr-like seed pods. The plant features compound leaves with small, narrow leaflets and is often found in dry, sandy soils. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes many legumes known for their nitrogen-fixing abilities. Dendrolobium rostratum is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
